results.description:
This concert is a live remix of Stravinsky's Firebird Suite — the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra will play the original Stravinsky while "remix vignettes," which include segments of the Stravinsky treated using modern popular/DJ/electronica production techniques, are juxtaposed with the orchestra's performance. Laptops, drum machines, synthesizers, singers, rappers, etc. are all in the mix!

FUSE@PSO begins at 5 p.m. (with the happy hour) followed by the concert starting at 6:30 p.m.

FUSE@PSO is a bold new approach to classical concerts. The brainchild of composer-conductor-producer Steve Hackman and presented by (and with) the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, this new series of early evening concerts fuses the old and the new, creating something that is at once a combination of both and wholly original.

Check out these articles about conductor Steve Hackman and the upcoming PSO concerts in Pittsburgh http://www.tablemagazine.com/table_live_posts/person-of-interest-steve-hackman/

http://www.nextpittsburgh.com/next-up/next-up-steve-hackman/

Check out these Firebird: Remix | Response concert notes to get an idea of how unique this concert will be http://blogs.pittsburghsymphony.org/2016/03/notes-on-firebird-remix-response/

https://youtu.be/ff32TkeTOmM?t=36

For the Pittsburgh concert on March 9, all tickets include general admission to the 6:30 PM concert as well as a happy hour (with $3-$5 drink specials) beginning at 5 PM.  Because everyone has different work schedules and commuting distances to downtown, we'll plan to meet around 6 PM although others in the group can certainly arrive even earlier to enjoy more of the happy hour.

This event is not expected to sell out -- and so you should be able to buy tickets at the door.

And depending on the interests of the group, we could also meet for a drink or something and check some more live music at NOLA (in Market Square, about a one block walk) after the Heinz Hall concert ends around 8-8:30 PM.

TICKETS & Meetup Discount! While all regular tickets are $30 advance ($35 door) and include general admission to the happy hour and concert -- a Meetup Discount promo code explorepgh has been setup (which was kindly arranged by the Explore Pittsburgh! Meetup group with the PSO) for $24.25 discount tickets and so you'll save $11 as compared to buying at the door!!  Please note that Explore Pittsburgh! will have many members (from another 20+ RSVPs) attending this concert and so we'll have a chance to meet even more people and thank them for extending the explorepgh promo code to our group.

Tickets can be purchased by visiting or calling the Heinz Hall Box Office [masked]), visiting or calling the Theater Square Box Office [masked]) or going online http://www.pittsburghsymphony.org/production/46643/fuse-at-pso-stravinskys-firebird-remix-%7C-response And when you go online, just simply insert the explorepgh promo code and then the $24.25 discount ticket option will appear before you check out.

To learn more about the Explore Pittsburgh! Meetup group, please visit http://www.meetup.com/Explore-Pittsburgh/

For more information about the PSO and other concerts coming up, please visit http://www.pittsburghsymphony.org/pso_home

As always, it is also fine if you'd like to attend this concert on your own with family/friends instead.

Stay tuned for updates!

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.
results.how_to_find_us: While the happy hour begins at 5 PM, everyone has different work schedules and commuting distances to downtown, and so we'll try to meet around 6 PM in the Heinz Hall Lobby. And perhaps meet at NOLA afterwards (8:30 PM) for a drink & more live music.
results.name: FUSE@PSO: Stravinsky's Firebird: Remix | Response (& pre-show happy hour!)

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."

results.description:
Let's discuss "Between You & Me: Confessions of a Comma Queen" by Mary Norris and enjoy an evening at White Rabbit. 

The book is available on Amazon. Here's an Amazon.com Review:

"An Amazon Best Book of April 2015: Once upon a time, a couple or few decades ago, most American boys and girls in grade school were taught grammar and punctuation; we learned, for example, that “i” came before “e,” except after “c” (except sometimes, but never mind) and that the verb “to be” was “like an equal sign,” which meant that you used the nominative case (have I lost you yet?) on both sides of it. (“It is I,” in other words, is the correct, if dowdy, response to “Who’s there?”) Some of us were even taught to diagram sentences; some had parents who corrected us at the family dinner table. (I can still hear my father pressing the subjunctive upon me. “If I WERE,” he’d bellow, when I allowed as how there’d be later curfews if I “was” in charge.) Whether they retained the lessons or not, most people probably don't wax romantic about the grammar lessons or teachers of yore.

Which is why even those of you who don’t have the soul of a second-grade grammar teacher will love Between You and Me, the hilarious and delightful “memoir” by the longtime New Yorkercopy editor, Mary Norris, who confides in the subtitle that she is a “comma queen.” (The above is not a full sentence, I know -- but I think I can get away with it by calling it "my style." Also, I put quotation marks around the word “memoir,” Mary – I know you’re wondering -- because I was trying to make the point that your book is an unusual take on the form, dealing as it does with thats and whiches as well as with your Ohio adolescence as a foot-checker at the local pool.) Who knew grammar could be so much fun -- that silly marks of punctuation could be so wickedly anthropomorphized (a question mark is like a lazy person), that dashes grow in families (there are big dashes and little dashes and they can all live peaceably within one sentence), that there was once a serious movement to solve the he-or-she problem with the catchall “heesh”? Clearly, Norris knows: her book is plenty smart, but it’s its (one’s a contraction, one’s a possessive) joyful, generous style that makes it so winning. This is a celebration of language that won’t make anyone feel dumb – but it’s also the perfect gift for the coworker you haven’t been able to tell that “between” is a preposition that never, ever, takes an object that includes the pronoun “I.” – Sara Nelson
results.name: Book Club!

results.description:
Many doctors struggle to talk honestly and openly with their patients nearing end of life. Renowned surgeon, Dr. Atul Gawande explored this topic in his bestselling book Being Mortal.

Join us to view a 50-minute PBS Frontline video featuring Dr. Gawande's personal journey-and the stories of his patients and their families. The film explores the ways in which having a conversation around the question "What are your priorities if your time is limited?" can empower patients to live their lives more fully. Being Mortal shines an unprecedented spotlight on how patients, families, and doctors all experience the stages of life, for the ultimate goal is not a good death, but a good life-all the way to the very end.

Please join Dr. Myles Zuckerman, Board Certified Hospice and Palliative Physician at Family Hospice, Jane Barthen, Hospice Social Worker andBarbara Ivanko, President and CEO, Family Hospice for a facilitated discussion at the end of the film.
results.name: The Choices We Make: A Reflection on Being Mortal

results.description:
The first 21 people that RSVP will be eligible for play. If you signed up for league play on Tuesday or Wednesday RSVP here and we will mark you as Paid.  Join us for a 1-hour session of basketball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $8- RSVP & PREPAY using paypal. Send payment to [masked]  (online RSVP closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay with cash/check at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear basketball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 21 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Cool Springs 1530 Hamilton Rd.
Pittsburgh, Pa 15234 Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult basketball group. You must be 19 older. Males of all skill levels are welcome to play. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

Code and Coffee is a monthly opportunity for you to work on your own projects, continue practicing what you've been learning, and meet others who share your interests. Bring your laptop, your recent projects, and your programming problems and questions.

Have a project idea and some skills, but haven’t attended a GDI event yet? Want to focus on helping others with their projects? You're welcome too!

results.description:
Enough with the "chord searching," and now let's jam, song-circle style. Bring your 365 Daily Ukulele  and a stand.

============

WHAT IS "Beginner Plus"


On Second Wednesdays, we play familiar tunes at a slower pace. You’ve already taken some lessons. Now it’s time to talk about some basic strums, alternate chord fingering, and how to move and slide between chords. Learn tricks, cheats and other valuable info geared to newer players and also to those who just like to hang out and play with a group. 

Below are basic chords, get comfortable with them. Notice how many chord changes take barely a slide of your fingers. Sometimes a finger just stays in place...

Key of C:  C  D7,   C    F,   F   G7,  G7   Am,  G7    C

Key of G:  G    D7,  G   C,  C  D7,  the barred D7 and Em,  G   Em,    D7    G

results.description:
The first 21 people that RSVP will be eligible for play. If you signed up for league play on Tuesday or Wednesday RSVP here and we will mark you as Paid.  Join us for a 1-hour session of basketball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $8- RSVP & PREPAY using paypal. Send payment to [masked] (online RSVP closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash/check at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear basketball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 21 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Cool Springs 1530 Hamilton Rd.
Pittsburgh, Pa 15234 Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult basketball group. You must be 19 older. Males of all skill levels are welcome to play. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

This event is organized by Mobile Growth Academy. 

Our meetup group is collaborating by promoting this event.

This event is a webinar. You can participate online via your computer or any web-enabled device.

Participation in this event is free.

In order to participate, please register here:

https://mga.samcart.com/referral/Free-Webinar/143147 

(After you register, you will receive info on how to get onto the webinar.)

Without a well engineered mobile-centric marketing system in place (like 90% of startups), you will most likely struggle to build consistent traction to grow your app before you run out of money  -- and, consequently, kill your startup.

In this webinar, you will learn the marketing systems of leading Silicon Valley apps, including real world examples that will help you grow the user base for your app -- even if you don't have a marketing team or a marketing budget.

The speaker will cover:

• The six signs your marketing is killing your startup (without you knowing) and how to fix them.

• The four critical stages of marketing you need to master.

• A simple free hack to grow your installs by 40x.

• How to hack Whatsapp to earn free installs

• How to hack the app stores to 5x your organic installs

 and  more....!

About the Speaker

Nagi Salloum has 12 years of marketing expertise and is currently the founder and CEO of the Mobile Growth Academy, an online platform that offers mobile startups a step-by-step guide to help them market and grow their apps. 

Prior to that, Nagi was the head of global product marketing for Tango Messenger, a Silicon Valley company that raised over $350M and has 400M users worldwide. Nagi also served as the chief marketing officer at N2V, a leading internet investment group, a regional marketing executive for Google, and as a regional brand manager for Procter and Gamble.

Nagi is also a board member, mentor and advisor to dozens of tech startups in Silicon Valley, Norway, Spain, Portugal, Mexico, UAE, UK, Germany, Egypt, Lebanon and many other countries.

If you have questions about the content of this webinar, please contact Nagi at:

[masked]

There is no requirement to register and no cost. All participants must be well. Please do bring your baby with you.

Pregnant mothers, currently breastfeeding mothers, mothers who are pumping and bottlefeeding, mothers who have breastfed in the past are all welcome to participate.

Meetings are led by a lactation consultant from Heritage Valley Sewickley. There is a scale available for weighing babies. Some meetings focus on a particular topic, but generally there is no specific topic. Specific topics can be addressed if requested by group participants.

Meetings of the Breastfeeding Moms Network are normally held on the 2nd and 4th Thursday evening of the month--except November and December when it is only the 2nd Thursday evening.

Storkbites is for all new mothers with a baby under a year old. Those meetings are on Tuesday mornings and moms can attend whether they are breast or formula feeding their babies.

results.description:
This is a discussion group EN FRANCAIS for those (intermediate and higher) wishing to perfect their conversational French.

I will bring materials for learning/teaching.  This will include 1 song, but there will also be a chapter from:

• La grammaire à l'oeuvre (John Barson-Stanford) - many consider to be the best grammar/conversation book ever written (I have French friends who use it for review).  John Barson was interested in using science fiction, art and other unusual 'gaming' techniques in perfecting grammar and expression.


• Le français Départ/Arrivée (Rassias - Dartmouth) - another classic text.  Rassias was by nature a theater person, and originator of a unique language learning method - very much "in your face" and physical-response oriented.


I will also focus on practicing authentic French phrases and pronunciation.

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.

results.description:
There are over 50,000 residents living in Pittsburgh's Northside neighborhoods and until now there have been no open Toastmasters clubs for these communities. 

That changes with the establishment of the Northside Toastmasters to serve the community and develop its current and future leaders. In our meetings, members present prepared speeches, receive written and oral evaluations, practice impromptu speaking, and share fellowship in a supportive, non-intimidating environment. These experiences develop our members into greater communicators while practicing essential leadership skills. 

Toastmasters is a safe place to fail, to practice, to learn, and to grow into the best leader and communicator you can be. Come visit and find out what we can do for you! 

Current Toastmasters:

Please help us make this club a success and introduce this community to the incredible benefits Toastmasters has to offer. We need help spreading the word and ensuring that meetings run smoothly. If you are interested in volunteering to speak, fulfill a meeting role, or helping to promote the club; please let me know ASAP. If you are interested in sponsoring or mentoring this club (and earning credit toward your Advanced Leader Silver award in the process) please contact me directly. 


Thank you in advance for helping to bring the benefits of Toastmasters to the diverse and underserved communities of the Northside. Your involvement makes a difference!

Please note: The club will continue to meet at this location on the 2nd & 4th Thursday of each month from 6:30-7:30pm. Meetings are free and open to the public, all are welcome!
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in the main meeting room, straight ahead through the glass doors when you enter the Library.

results.description: Astronomy and photography are both about the light–and both are delightful. Join videographer and motion graphic artist Dean Mougianis, artist, musician and programmer Giselle Jhunjhnuwala and astronomer Diane Turnshek as they examine the beauty of the heavens through the technique of light painting. Create intricate, beautiful patterns through long photographic exposures and moving light sources. In this workshop, participants will use a variety of light sources and “paint” with them to create images in real time, centered on the theme of planets and stars. We’ll talk about planetary orbits and celestial motion. Participants will leave with digital copies of their artistic creations. Come have fun, make delightful images and learn about the wonders of the night sky. Free. Appropriate for all ages, from the young to the young at heart. http://assemblepgh.org/event/de-lightful-imagery/
results.name: Light Painting “De-Lightful Imagery”

results.description:
An advance welcome to you – our prospective guest…

Perhaps you’ve been thinking about going to a Toastmasters meeting for awhile.

Maybe you’re not quite certain what to expect, and so you’ve hesitated.

Given that fear of public speaking has ranked as the top phobia for quite some time, you’ve got plenty of company! At the same time, the most important skill, and it is indeed a “skill” -- not something that one is born with, or is “automatically” comfortable and effective for anyone -- is communication.

How we communicate influences most every aspect of our personal and professional lives. Wherever you happen to be in your communications process, the supportive environment of our club can make a positive difference. As renowned and respected motivational speaker Les Brown has maintained throughout his impressive career, “Practice makes improvement.”

You may notice that the emphasis is NOT upon perfection, but rather, upon effort and growth, over the course of time. We hope that you will consider Club 1104 – Penn Hills Toastmasters as a place where you can feel comfortable and encouraged as you embark upon your path to improved communication.

See you at the next meeting!

http://1104.toastmastersclubs.org/

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."

results.description:
Hello everyone!

I am back in Pittsburgh and looking forward to some cerebral stimulation this Friday!  

I have a collection of new games in my queue and some fantastic older ones looking to hit the table.  

The attendance while I was away was very good between ten and twenty gamers every week and the feedback that I received was very positive.  Hats off to Western PA Gamers Co-organizers for keeping the ship running every week that I was away.  

I will be looking forward seeing everyone this Friday and hope to see some new faces as well.

I will be continuing the weekly Friday meetups for now but investigating some alternative venues in the future.

Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...

Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

results.description:
http://www.carnegiesciencecenter.org/programs/adult-programs-21-plus-night/

21+ Food Science with Wigle Whiskey

March 11, 2016

Explore the science of food and drink at 21+ Food Science with Wigle Whiskey:

Learn about different aspects of taste then try a free sample of Wigle spirits to put your knowledge to the test.
Check out the concepts of about fermentation, malting, and distilling.
Discover how sight, taste, and smell combine to give us the full experience of taste.
Uncover how your genes can affect your taste preference while testing bitters from Wigle.
Uncover how your genes can affect your taste preference while testing bitters from Wigle. Are you a super taster? Depending on your genetic make-up, some people taste a chemical called Phenylthiocarbamide as intensely bitter while others can't taste it at all. Put your taste buds to the test to find out which group you fall into, then learn about Wigle's variety of bitters that can be used in cocktails.
Try free samples of Wigle spirits to coincide with different science experiments.
Watch yeast convert carbohydrates into CO2. Then, watch as we pit different substances against each other to create the most gas. Honey, sugar, flour? Which will be the most successful gas producer? Examine different stages of honey that Wigle ferments to make their "Landlocked" spirit.
Learn the importance of malting. Sample malted and unmalted grains. Participate in a science activity where we use enzymes in saliva to break down starches into sugars, similar to the malting process.
Get molecular as we demonstrate the process of specification. With help from a little bit of chemistry, we can rearrange molecules of fruit juice to form juice-filled "caviar."
Explore the states of matter with liquid nitrogen. Try a frozen marshmallow and discover how temperature plays a role in cocktails.
Enjoy $15 in free slot play at Rivers Casino, available at the ticket counter during the event while supplies last!

results.description:
CEDDO

A Film by Ousmane Sembène

6:00 PM [Doors Open at 5 PM)

Filmmaker Ousmane Sembène, whose goal in making cinema was “to give voice to millions of voiceless, disenfranchised Africans” is considered the Father of African Cinema.

CEDDO, considered Sembène’s most ambitious film, uses the story of a beautiful princess’s kidnapping to examine the confrontation between opposing cultural forces: Muslim expansion, Christianity, and the slave trade. Banned in Senegal when it was released, CEDDO was the official selection 10th International Moscow Film Festival in 1977.

Nominally set in the nineteenth century, CEDDO ranges far and wide to include philosophy, fantasy, militant politics, and a couple of electrifying leaps across the centuries to evoke the whole of the African experience. 

Samba Gadjigo, Ph. D., Professor of French and African Studies at Mount Holyoke College in Massachusetts, is the official biographer of Ousmane Sembéne and a filmmaker ; and will be our guest for  Q&A.  African Historian  Jean-Jacques Sene, Ph. D., will moderate.
results.name: SEMBENE CLASSIC "CEDDO" SCREENS WITH GUEST SAMBA GADJIGO

results.description:
Come - let us learn how to play mah jong or seriously play mah jong and have some fun. Limit is 16  for this event. Please post that you are a beginner if you need instructions.  I suggest beginners try to get there by 6 pm to allow time to learn and then have a game or two after that. But come whenever you can.

If you plan to eat, try to come earlier or finish your food before you sit in for a game. I found out that mah jong is not a good game to be eating and playing at the same time. Since we are using the facilities of Panera, no outside food or drinks please.  Also please purchase a drink or snack or food to support them for allowing us to use their facilities.


Another group has already reserved the Community Room, so the manager said we could use the bigger round tables outside the Room. It will still be in the back area of the restaurant.

results.description:
21+ Food Science with Wigle Whiskey

March 11, 2016

Explore the science of food and drink at 21+ Food Science with Wigle Whiskey:

Learn about different aspects of taste then try a free sample of Wigle spirits to put your knowledge to the test.
Check out the concepts of about fermentation, malting, and distilling.
Discover how sight, taste, and smell combine to give us the full experience of taste.
Uncover how your genes can affect your taste preference while testing bitters from Wigle.
Uncover how your genes can affect your taste preference while testing bitters from Wigle. Are you a super taster? Depending on your genetic make-up, some people taste a chemical called Phenylthiocarbamide as intensely bitter while others can't taste it at all. Put your taste buds to the test to find out which group you fall into, then learn about Wigle's variety of bitters that can be used in cocktails.
Try free samples of Wigle spirits to coincide with different science experiments.
Watch yeast convert carbohydrates into CO2. Then, watch as we pit different substances against each other to create the most gas. Honey, sugar, flour? Which will be the most successful gas producer? Examine different stages of honey that Wigle ferments to make their "Landlocked" spirit.
Learn the importance of malting. Sample malted and unmalted grains. Participate in a science activity where we use enzymes in saliva to break down starches into sugars, similar to the malting process.
Get molecular as we demonstrate the process of specification. With help from a little bit of chemistry, we can rearrange molecules of fruit juice to form juice-filled "caviar."
Explore the states of matter with liquid nitrogen. Try a frozen marshmallow and discover how temperature plays a role in cocktails.
Enjoy $15 in free slot play at Rivers Casino, available at the ticket counter during the event while supplies last!

No Bad JuJu is a dynamic 8-piece powerhouse featuring two lead vocalists/ instrumentalists backed by a driving rhythm and horn section. results.description:
What:: GASP Games Day 
Where:: Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
When:: 10am to 11pm 
Cost:: $5 (first time attendees are free)

Due to our situation in finding a new home, Games Days are currently on a month-2-month schedule. See below for the schedule, it will be updated as needed.

2016 Dates


• January 30th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church 

• February 20th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• March 12th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• April - Date and Location TBD

• May - Date and Location TBD

• June - Date and Location TBD

• July - Date and Location TBD

• August - Date and Location TBD

• September - Date and Location TBD

• October - Date and Location TBD

• November - Date and Location TBD

• December - Date and Location TBD

The address for the church is located at the bottom of the page

Game Days run from 10am till 11pm, and are open to everyone. There is a small fee per person ($5) to attend Games Day, to cover the cost of the rental hall. This fee is waived for all first-time attendees. The fee will be collected when you arrive, and will grant access to all the games contributed by our members, for use that day. We will be holding off taking any new yearly payments, but those that did pay will be honored.

Speaking of games, there are always a multitude of board, card, role-playing, and miniature games being played on any given Game Day, but a few events are near constants.

• Our Multi-Player Magic League runs each Game Day, starting around 11am. It’s a league that runs Jan-Oct. There is a second league starting at 4:30PM with modified rules and decks, please read the forum post for more information.

• Several RPG campaigns are also run each Game Day, including our "One-Shot Saturdays", stand-alone adventures run by various GMs each month.

• There are several miniature games that regularly appear at each Game Day. These vary each month, but some examples are X-Wing, Bolt Action, Lord of the Rings, Firestorm Armada, Dystopian Wars, Axis and Allies: War at Sea & Angels 20, BattleTech, AT-43, Infinity, and others.

• Don’t forget our extensive board game contingent. You can always find players for a board game, whether you bring your own or try out one of the many titles our BGers own and bring each month to our Games Library.

We ask that everyone attending our Game Days brings something along as a snack and/or drink, for the community to share in. The facility has a full kitchen, so items that need refrigerated are OK. Most people bring some soda, chips, cookies, veggie tray, etc. This helps everyone have a good time without worrying about snacks or drinks.

See you at Games Day!


Location Information:: 
Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
859 Pittsburgh Street 
Springdale, PA 15144

results.description:
Meet up for March 12, 2016

Our next meetup is a must for any real estate investor who wants to buy and hold for long term personal wealth. We are going to discuss the following

1.  What is ROI? We'll be working with spreadsheets and analyzing one of our current projects

2.  Can a property that loses money each month actually be a good investment?

3.  Is it better to buy a turnkey property or one that needs a lot of work?

4.  Whats the better investment, single family homes, small multi family or large multi family?

5.  What are the tax advantages that real estate offers and how can I use that to increase my ROI?

6.  How to quickly analyze an investment and evaluate what  is a realistic ROI including evaluating market rents, vacancy, capital improvements, management, utilities, taxes, insurance and general repairs and initial repairs if there is work needed from day one.


We will have a guest speaker Matthew L. Stevans CPA with over 25 years’ experience heavily weighted in residential and commercial real estate.

Matt will answer your questions, help you navigate through the tax advantages of different corporate structures, and how to find the deductions that some CPA's miss.

This will be a full house, so please RSVP to ensure enough materials and seating.

results.description:
With more than 100,000 spectators lining the streets - Pittsburgh's annual St. Patrick's Day Parade - is just as popular a holiday tradition, as is wearing the color green during this historic Celtic celebration. The parade starts at the intersection of Liberty Avenue and 11th Street, and proceeds to Grant Street, and then on to the Boulevard of the Allies, where it will turn right and head down the Boulevard of the Allies to the reviewing stand at Stanwix Street, and will end at Commonwealth Place. The parade begins at 10 AM and ends at 2 PM. After the parade, the fun continues at downtown Pittsburgh's Market Square for the Irish Fair in the Square, where all are invited to gather for a family-friendly day of live music, street performances, and more.

This event is so big, it's hard to schedule it as a meet up. Since we are all from different areas around Pittsburgh, it would be difficult to find a convenient meeting place for everyone. So just attend and take lots of shots! 

Please RSVP if you plan to attend and post your photos. The parade starts at 10 but you might want to get there a lot earlier than that. If you've never been to this, let me tell you, it can be CRAZY but a lot of fun!!!! Top of the morning to ya!!! Lol

Just comment or contact fellow members if you'd like to arrange to meet each other.  😊

• review lab book exercises (on google drive)

results.description:
Part 3 of a three part learning experience to discover innate intuition within yourself, and once found how to use it to self-empower, spiritually grow and enhance your life.

Intuition is like a spiritual muscle, if left unattended and not used becomes dormant and resides deep within your consciousness. Once you acknowledge your intuition and accept its power to move you in directions that include the spirit realm, an illumination occurs to shine light on a once hidden way of experiencing.

Listening to your inner voice is often suggested, but we must first know just what that is. The group "Finding Your Intuitive Voice" will inform you how to know your voice, and through group work will practice using your intuition so it becomes second nature to live a life intuitively.

Facilitator is Suzanne Bishop, a nationally known psychic medium who is from Pittsburgh. To learn more about intuition and the psychic world discover Intuit Now at intuitz.com.
results.name: Finding Your Intuitive Voice

See you tonight the weather is perfect!

DRESS IN YOUR FINEST SAINT PATRICK's DAY FINERY! This is Pittsburgh's Mardi Gras!

Pittsburgh Pub Crawl - International

Presents

St. Patrick's Day!

Millvale Bar Crawl!

"Avoiding the Amateurs!"

Sat. Mar 12th, +21 Event. Cost $5

If a bar is TOO CROWDED, scout ahead to the next one, get a drink (or food). TO GET IN WITH NO COVER YOU MUST BE REGISTERED and have a Crawl Bracelet $5

6:00 - 6:40pm Barking Shark Saloon- 616 North Avenue Millvale - Get NAMETAGS & Wristband Here!  $2 Domestic Drafts, $2.50 Domestic Bottles also a good place to get a sammich! N'at! Smoking Bar

6:40pm - 7:30pm Sidelines Bar & Grill - 621 Evergreen Road- 616 North Avenue Millvale - Get NAMETAGS & Wristband Here! GET FOOD HERE!!! it's good! $20 all you can eat snow crab legs!  Great Wings also! Car Bomb Special!

Remember RULE NUMBER #1 "No Whinning!"

TWO FINE MILLVALE DIVES (they are small, so if too crowded go to the Next Bar)

7:30-8:15 Happy Day Lounge -313 North Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15209 Cheapest Bar in Millvale!  Bottom Shelf Mixed drinks $2.25!  Smoking Bar

7:30-8:15 Smokey's Tavern - 139 Howard Street Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15209 $2 Yeungling Smoking Bar

8:20pm-9:15 The Grist House Brewery - This place will be packed, there will be a FOOD TRUCK HERE! 10 Sherman Street Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15209  Very Tasty Brews! They close at 10pm.

9:20pm-10:30pm Draai Laag Brewing Company - 501 East Ohio Street Very Tasty Sour style beers. This brewery closes at 10:30pm Currently Pouring: Relic, Apples & Pears,Petite Ferme, Haviken, CRU. FOOD BY Black Shepherd Farms

10:30-11:15pm Cousins Bar- 203 Grant Avenue Pittsburgh Magazine's:"Best HOLE in the Wall, Bar!" $6 Pizzas! Specialty Drinks include: Irish Sex Nut, Irish Breakfast, Celtic Ginger. Smoking Bar

11:15pm to Close Double L Bar -307 Grant Ave 16 Beers on Tap

Remember Rule #1: "No Whinning!"

THIS IS A CHARITY CRAWL: You can bring $5 cash

2. It is good to tip; it is not so good to assume you know the best place to put the bills.

3. If you ignore the whistle and show up late to the next bar or without a nametag, you may not get the special and you may have to pay the cover to get in. You can get nametags at the first 4 bars.

4. You are responsible for your behavior. If you get drunk, it is your own fault, not our fault and not the bar's. Take a cab\UBER\LYFT Home!

5. You are also responsible for the people you invite. If you know someone is a nasty or problem drunk, do not invite him\her.

results.description:
It's Women's History Month ladies and at this meeting I'd like us to spend an hour talking about a woman you admire and that has played an inspirational role in your life. Woman's History month pays tribute to the generations of women whose commitment to nature and the planet have proved invaluable to all of us.
Pick a woman you admire, and each of us will share for a few minutes why we chose her, she could be an author, an actress, a musician, a game changer, an artist, an activist, a feminist. a politician, a news anchor, a journalist, a photographer.
If you are not sure, research one that you have always wanted to get to know, read a short biography and bring it to our meeting.
It is important to honor women who have changed our lives , without them it would be a very different world.
After our discussion we will "catch up" with each other and share anything you would like to share with the group.
In April we will resume with another "Trigger" discussion.
results.name: Women's History Month

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

results.description:
I bet you've had some success networking at events? If you have, you might have met great potential prospects, had good conversations, collected business cards and promised to email them.

But I often get asked, what do you do once you have their email?
- How do you get them to buy from you?
- How do you schedule them into a meeting?
- How do you nurture the relationship to build trust and authority?
- How often do you send them emails?

Getting noticed in between all the emails, newsletters and spam we receive is no easy task, and a good, timely email can make a huge difference to your revenue. Email marketing may seem boring compared to some of the cool tools and gadgets on the market, but there is no denying that email is still a tool with amazing ROI.
35+ of the best email marketing experts on the planet will shortly be gathering in one place...

It's called the Email Success Summit. https://rk285.isrefer.com/go/ess-main/freeticket181/

From March 14-23 you can attend this online conference from your office (or couch..) And we have some free tickets to give away!

Our friends over at Small Today have set aside a block of complimentary tickets to the Email Success Summit which offers the chance to learn the habits of the the planets best email marketers, for Network After Work members like yourself.

To secure your free ticket before they are gone, simply click here. https://rk285.isrefer.com/go/ess-main/freeticket181/

Do you need more leads and are struggling to get meetings and sales from your emails? If you're faced with low response rates, if you can't get people to buy, if you can't get people to meet with you - the Email Success Summit will put you on the straight and narrow.

This online event will show you how to make money every time you send an email. It's that simple.

Get the details and reserve your seat; https://rk285.isrefer.com/go/ess-main/freeticket181/
results.name: Free Tickets - Email Success Summit - Online Event

group.name: Network After Work - Pittsburgh Networking Events

results.description:
To facilitate meaningful conversations as a single group, this MeetUp is limited to 10 participants. The charge for the MeetUp will be left as a group tip to the server. We will display an 8.5" x 11.0" sign to help you find the activity. You can see a copy of the sign in the "General Pictures" Photo Album.

INTRODUCTIONS


We will have a round of introductions during each meeting. This will give you the opportunity to present yourself, your company, and your product or service to everyone else in the room. You should bring at least 15 business cards to hand out to the group as you make your introduction. Please be courteous and respectful of everyone's interest level and time -- KEEP YOUR INTRODUCTION TO 60 SECONDS OR LESS! We don't have to vacate the room immediately after the activity; if anyone is interested in learning more about your product or service, they can have a longer conversation with you right after the activity.

GUEST SPEAKER


We will have a different guest speaker every month. You can find the guest speaker that will be joining us on any particular month by looking at "Guest Speakers" under the "Discussion" tab.

WALK IN POLICY


We want to encourage attendees to RSVP for the meetings, and discourage walk-ins without an RSVP. The RSVPs help us with the planning and coordination of the meetings. Walk-ins without an RSVP will be charged $20. This fee is in addition to and separate from the cost of the lunch. The reason for this charge is to be fair with the participants that took the time and effort to RSVP. Individuals that walk in without an RSVP may have to sit at a side table separate from the main table that is reserved for participants with an RSVP. As a reminder, we want to keep the meeting limited to a small group of participants so we can have a single meaningful conversation, instead of various fragmented and superficial conversations.
results.name: Networking Lunch

results.description:
Have you ever had a stakeholder ask something a little overboard during requirements sessions? Worse still, have you ever run through a checklist of standard requirements and the stakeholder says "Yes, we need that" to every single item? It can be hard to tell what the project needs and what the stakeholder is asking for, just because they're conditioned to ask for everything they want.

Unnecessary requirements drive up the cost of software implementations, add more points of failure, and, by definition, add no value. But how do you handle a stakeholder who wants their tax software suite to include a flight simulator? We'll discuss several techniques for evaluating and challenging stakeholders' unreasonable "requirements".

Agenda


5:30 Sign in, light dinner (pizza or subs usually), get to know other BAs.
6:00 Introductions
6:15 BA Technique of the Month..NEW! We're going do 15 minutes a month promoting different BA techniques.
6:30 Presentation
7:30 Close

Fees
Chapter Members...FREE
Students.....................FREE
First Timers................FREE
Non-members...........$10

Because all our meetings are held in secure buildings with stern, no-nonsense security guards, complete with clipboards and guest lists, we need you to register on our chapter website for each meeting.

Pittsburgh.IIBA.org

results.description: The philosophy of "A Course In Miracles" is criticized by many, but understood by few. The book's soul-inspiring concept of "forgiveness of everything" is made much easier by recognizing the reality that reality is an illusion (and we can thank Jesus, Buddha, Krishna, the Zohar, Einstein and others for helping us all get that by now). A miracle, The Course teaches, is something that can be "performed" by all of us. In the bible, 1 John 4:18 says, "Perfect love casts out fear." Perfecting love is what we (as vessels of light) are here to do ... and its result is simply miraculous.

results.description:
Join us and attend one or all six Practice of Happiness/Positive Psychology master classes. Each month you will learn how to experience more joy, fulfillment, satisfaction, and happiness by applying the six components of positive psychology to your everyday life.

Laura Parkinson, who has a master's degree in counseling psychology and 30 years' corporate training experience, will present these master classes. Each class will include enthusiastic mini-lectures, lively discussions, recommended readings, and useful application exercises.

Fell free to attend any one of the six classes. If you attend all six classes, you will receive the Library's Certificate of Completion. Both teens and adults are welcome to attend. No registration is required.

All classes are FREE.

These are the dates and topics of each class:

1. Introduction to the practice of happiness/positive psychology, and in-depth focus on increasing your vitality. Monday, 2/15, 7-8:30 pm, room A.

2. Increasing your vitality applications review, and in-depth focus on expressing your true values and experiencing greater meaning. Monday, 3/14, 7-8:30 pm, room A.

results.description:
The University of Pittsburgh is organizing a final event for their ongoing Meditererranean MetaGeographies conversation that will see the Sicialian author Lina Prosa coming to Pittsburgh for lectures at Pitt.


Lina Prosa has written a compelling Trilogy on the journey of the migrants to Lampedusa within a social contest that sees the protagonist Shauba sharing with the reader what that journey turns out to be really like, from preparation to end.

The Italian and French Department of the University of Pittsburgh is organizing the reading of the piece “Lampedusa Beach” on Monday March 14th at 7pm in Italian and Tuesday March 15th at 7pm in English at the Heyman Theater. This event is FREE.

I would encourage you all to attend. Lina Prosa will be available for Q&A.
More information on the event is in the attached flyer.
Grazie a tutte,
Viviana

Lampedusa Beach è il primo dei tre testi che compongono la Trilogia del naufragio di Lina Prosa.
Scritto nel 2003 è stato prodotto e messo in scena nel 2013, a Parigi, dalla Comédie-Française. Il Teatro Biondo di Palermo ha recentemente prodotto l’intera Trilogia per la regia della stessa autrice. Si tratta di un intenso monologo sull’emigrazione clandestina, la testimonianza di Shauba, una giovane africana naufragata al largo di Lampedusa. Inghiottita dal mare, racconta la sua esperienza: il sogno di una vita migliore, l’ingiustizia del mondo, ma anche il suo rapporto primordiale con l'acqua, con la sua identità mediterranea. “Il tempo della discesa del corpo negli abissi coincide con il tempo della scrittura”, spiega Lina Prosa. “La parola annegata di Shauba dà vita a un’odissea sott’acqua in cui la fine, l’arrivo al fondo, è un respiro lungo elevato a racconto”.
results.name: A night at the theater - Lampedusa Beach (by Lina Prosa) (in Italian)

results.description:
***********************

To join the partner program please just go through our Join Page:  http://PittsburghTennisLeague.com/join
***********************

How does the PittsburghTennis Partner Program Work?

Partner Program Basic Concept

  We connect you with up to 30 Men and/or Women based upon your playing region and skill level. These are tennis players who love the sport and joined the program to meet up with you on the courts. The Partner Program is less competitive as there are no champions crowned and no league standings. The program provides dedicated tennis partners who want to meet up with you on the courts.

 PittsburghTennis's tennis partner program is broken down to these playing regions: Pittsburgh.

 The partner program is a monthly subscription service. The Partner Program is ongoing and remains open as long as the weather is good enough to play outdoor tennis. This is NOT a doubles program.

Your Task-"Scheduling and Meeting up with the other players"

  You meet up with the players to play either a match or just hit around. PittsburghTennis's objective to ensure players are actively playing. We try to use an incentive system to push players along. Anyone who plays 3 different partners in a calendar month will get another month of service for free.

Where to Play?

  The league strongly suggests that players jointly choose a tennis court location convenient to both. We now geo-locate your program contacts which means you should receive partners closer to your preferred playing location. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts for each area, including details such as # of courts, lighting, hitting walls and links to google maps for directions. Members can submit court ratings on the overall condition, surface, lighting quality, facility management, and general comments regarding specific courts. This will provide players with up-to-date court information on new and existing courts. We encourage members to keep this list fresh and up-to-date.

Target Audience

  The Partner Program is for all level players. We encourage beginners to play in the Partner Program prior to playing in a league. We track the results of the Partner Program and may make skill rating adjustments based upon scores if necessary. Our program ensures fun, well-matched tennis partners for players of all levels.

Cost to Participate

  Price is variable depending on the # of months the player purchases. But it’s typically not more than $10/month. Any player that plays 3 or more different partners in a calendar month will get another month of service at no cost. In some *NEW* cities the program will be free as we are trying to build a dedicated tennis playing community. For details on your city please just refer to your homepage.

Tennis League Network Donations

  Our business charter is based upon doing the better good for players health and society. For 2015, we will continue to donate 2% to 4% of the Tennis Partner Program Entry fees to Cancer Research Institute. As of 7/1/15 we've donated $9,500.

Join Today!!

  So Join Today and we'd be happy to find you dedicated tennis playing partners.
results.name: Partner Program

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
results.name: Mah Jong in Shadyside! (Note:  Beginner class  also tonight!)

results.description:
Please ask at the host stand for the book club. We are usually in the back room against the windows, but you never know...

March's book is chick-lit by a male author! The Rosie Project by Graeme Simsion

From Amazon.com:

The art of love is never a science: Meet Don Tillman, a brilliant yet socially inept professor of genetics, who’s decided it’s time he found a wife. In the orderly, evidence-based manner with which Don approaches all things, he designs the Wife Project to find his perfect partner: a sixteen-page, scientifically valid survey to filter out the drinkers, the smokers, the late arrivers. 

Rosie Jarman possesses all these qualities. Don easily disqualifies her as a candidate for The Wife Project (even if she is “quite intelligent for a barmaid”). But Don is intrigued by Rosie’s own quest to identify her biological father. When an unlikely relationship develops as they collaborate on The Father Project, Don is forced to confront the spontaneous whirlwind that is Rosie―and the realization that, despite your best scientific efforts, you don’t find love, it finds you.

Arrestingly endearing and entirely unconventional, Graeme Simsion’s distinctive debut “navigates the choppy waters of adult relationships, both romantic and platonic, with a fresh take (USA TODAY). “Filled with humor and plenty of heart, The Rosie Project is a delightful reminder that all of us, no matter how we’re wired, just want to fit in” (Chicago Tribune).
results.why: We love to read, drink wine and talk about books!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the Host Stand for the Book Club
results.name: Shadyside Meeting - The Rosie Project by Graeme Simsion

results.description: Tuesday, March 15 (7 to 9 pm): “De-Lightful Imagery” Astronomy and photography are both about the light–and both are delightful. Join videographer and motion graphic artist Dean Mougianis, artist, musician and programmer Giselle Jhunjhnuwala and astronomer Diane Turnshek as they examine the beauty of the heavens through the technique of light painting. Create intricate, beautiful patterns through long photographic exposures and moving light sources. In this workshop, participants will use a variety of light sources and “paint” with them to create images in real time, centered on the theme of planets and stars. We’ll talk about planetary orbits and celestial motion. Participants will leave with digital copies of their artistic creations. Come have fun, make delightful images and learn about the wonders of the night sky. Free. Appropriate for all ages, from the young to the young at heart. http://assemblepgh.org/event/de-lightful-imagery/
results.name: Light Painting “De-Lightful Imagery”

results.description:
Tracking two parallel odysseys through the Amazon, this historical epic offers an ethno-botanical adventure, mysticism, and a heart rending depiction of an indigenous culture ravaged by colonialism. In 1909 an ailing German explorer is searching for an exceedingly rare flower that he believes could cure him of his fatal illness. A young shaman and ostensibly the last member of a decimated tribe is resentful of whites but offers to help on the condition that they will lead him to other surviving members of his tribe. Meanwhile, a parallel narrative set in 1940 follows American explorer, Richard Evans Schultes, on his own search for the elusive flower, in an Amazonian landscape brutalized by the rubber trade. The luscious black and white cinematography is never just pretty, there is always something unsettling and dark lurking in its corners. This is Columbia’s first-ever best foreign language Oscar nominee. In Spanish and Amazonian with subtitles. Here is the trailer: http://cinema.pfpca.org/films/embrace-of-the-serpent#
     
The show starts at 8:00 p.m. Let's meet in the lobby about 7:45 p.m.
results.name: Embrace of the Serpent

results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $9 - RSVP and pay cash at the event

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

results.description:
Fellow Agilists:


Is planning a pain? Do your retros need a refresh? Exactly how are new teams are supposed to get started anyway?

For this month's meetup, Hitesh Nangrani will help us crowd source some solutions from the 900+ members of this meetup group. 

Summa will be sponsoring this month's meetup; let's show them some love!

Format: 

• Step 1: Self-organize in teams of 3-5 members

• Step 2: Write pains onto post-it notes

• Step 3: Select a pain and problem solve within each team (time boxed) 

• Step 4: Branch out and diversify – repeat for other teams (time boxed) 

Take-Away: List of practical implementable solutions for you to try and resolve your problems

As always, snacks and refreshments will be provided, courtesy of Summa!

About Hitesh:

Hitesh is has been a technology professional for over 7 years; with 5 years of direct agile experience; which includes stints in development, requirements, and project management. He can be found on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/hitesh-nangrani-pmi-acp-pmp-csp-csm-a9642018; and Twitter as @hiteshnangrani

About Summa:

Summa is a digital solutions consultancy that combines its human-centered design, strategy and agile software development capabilities to power businesses and deliver engaging customer experiences.

You can find out more about this innovative company at summa.com

We hope to see you there!

results.description:
Our book for March is The Widow Waltz by Sally Koslow:

Chosen by People and USA Today as a Great Summer Read
  Georgia Waltz has an enviable life: a plush Manhattan apartment, a Hamptons beach house, two bright twenty-something daughters, and a seemingly perfect marriage. But when Ben dies suddenly, she discovers that her perfect lawyer-husband has left them nearly penniless. As Georgia scrambles to support the family, she and her daughters plumb for the grit required to reinvent their lives, and Georgia even finds that new love is possible in the land of Spanx.
  Inspiring, funny, and deeply satisfying, The Widow Waltz is a compulsively readable tale of forgiveness, healing, and the bonds between mothers and daughters.


Please bring books to suggest for our April meeting.

results.description:
DISGRACED

March 10 - April 10, 2016

by Ayad Akhtar

Amir is a hot-shot corporate lawyer in Manhattan. He’s also a Pakistani-American whose white wife is an artist interested in Islamic forms. When Amir is mistakenly linked to a Muslim leader, his world begins to unravel. Matters come to a head when he and his wife host a dinner party for another power couple – a Black female attorney and her Jewish husband. This 90-minute thrill ride won the 2013 Pulitzer Prize for Drama. This is your chance to see why.

This Pittsburgh Public Theater production of "Disgraced" will feature an amazing cast and set. 


Check out these great articles about the show http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/theater-dance/2016/03/10/Stage-preview-Pittsburgh-Public-Theater-and-Pulitzer-on-the-same-page-again-with-Disgraced/stories/201603100005

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/fajer-kaisi-stars-in-the-publics-production-of-disgraced/Content?oid=1900673

http://triblive.com/aande/theaterarts/10038456-74/brigden-says-amir

About the Mix@Six Ticket Offer

The Mix@Six pre-show reception begins at 6 pm in the 3rd floor rehearsal hall. Enjoy complimentary craft beer, food, coffee, and games before the 8 pm show.

The Mix@Six offer is a great deal -- while regular ticket prices are in the range of $30-$60 (depending on how close you sit to the stage), the Mix@Six ticket is only $25.75 which is also includes a 2-hour reception with complimentary craft beer, food, and social activities.  And if you are a student, the Mix@Six ticket is only $15.75!

TO ORDER Mix@Six TICKETS

To order best available $25.75 seats online anytime, please visit PPT.ORG with promo code MIXSIX.  There are also two options as far as seating:

1) Pick your Own Seats -- For example, if you wish to sit as close to the stage as possible or if you're going with family/friends instead.  To order the best available $25.75 seats online anytime, please visit PPT.ORG with promo code MIXSIX. 

2) Sit with Other People in the Meetup Group -- As a courtesy, Casey/Pittsburgh Public Theater will also reserve a number of seats in certain rows/sections and then members of the group can call Casey and request to be seated in these rows.  To sit with the Meetup group, you must purchase your tickets by Tuesday, March 15 and contact Casey directly at[masked] x704. Typical office hours are M-F 9am-5pm.

Of course, with either option, people will have a lot of time for meeting and socializing during the Mix@Six reception from 6-7:45 PM. And people can also talk more after the show ; for example, if they'd like to go for a quick drink after the show.

As always, it is also fine if you wish to enjoy this show on your own with family and friends instead. 

REGULAR TICKETS

Of course, if you can't make the Mix@Six on March 17, please consider checking out this wonderful play on one of the other performance dates (March 10, 2016 - April 10, 2016) as shown below.

For more information about this show or to order regular tickets, please visit http://ppt.org/shows/view/95

For more information about the Pittsburgh Public Theater and other upcoming productions as part of PPT's[masked] season, please visit http://ppt.org/

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

results.description:
Our MARCH SCRUG MEETING - Is a discussion and demonstration of Fast GPU Rendering with Octane Render and Unreal Engine 4 led by Patrick McKenzie of VEBH Architects.

Ever wanted to raytrace an image in 10 seconds, for a few hundred dollars? Now you can! Presenting Octane Render, the new video card-based rendering software that makes CPU-based rendering like Mental Ray obsolete and slow. Also, presenting Unreal Engine 4--the free development software that builds walkthroughs from Revit models with moving objects, particle effects like rain and steam, walking figures, trees waving in the wind, day-night cycle lighting, and lots more! It also has built-in support for the upcoming Oculus Rift VR headgear.

Sneak previews:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1aIl4VMyzxo https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y6PQ19BEE24
results.name: Fast GPU Rendering Today with Octane Render - MARCH SCRUG MEETING

results.description:
UPDATE - I will be in Illinois this Thursday to next Wed.  So - I can't attend this session. I'll leave it up just in case you want to still come.  

This is a discussion group EN FRANCAIS for those (intermediate and higher) wishing to perfect their conversational French.

I will bring materials for learning/teaching.  This will include 1 song, but there will also be a chapter from:

• La grammaire à l'oeuvre (John Barson-Stanford) - many consider to be the best grammar/conversation book ever written (I have French friends who use it for review).  John Barson was interested in using science fiction, art and other unusual 'gaming' techniques in perfecting grammar and expression.


• Le français Départ/Arrivée (Rassias - Dartmouth) - another classic text.  Rassias was by nature a theater person, and originator of a unique language learning method - very much "in your face" and physical-response oriented.


I will also focus on practicing authentic French phrases and pronunciation.

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.

results.description:
So here is a fun opportunity for those folks who want to dip a toe into boardgames. It's a chance for people new to the hobby to learn a game in a low-pressure environment. This will be a weekly series Thursdays in March at the Barnes and Noble at South Hills Village Mall. They will concentrate on a different game each week, where the store will demonstrate at least one game. A certain number of promotional items may also be available for the game that they demonstrate. Contact Barnes and Noble management for how they plan to distribute that if there are not enough to pass out to everyone.

This week, The event will center around the game Splendor.  We are trying to impress the nobility of England and Europe with the jewels our merchants can supply from the far east, and to win you must achieve a level of success and make your reputation stand out before your peers in the gem trades outdo you. So this is a victory point race, and the Gem Dealer with the highest score during the round that a player first achieves 15 cumulative victory points will win.  One will do that by trading gems for places that will produce gems for them on all of their future turns.  These parts of your supply chain may carry impressive victory points of their own, and some victory points are gained by being the first dealer that can fill a difficult order for a waiting noble.

The bookstore is running the event, and all questions about how many seats are available and similar concerns should be directed to them. But if you are new and you have been sitting on the sidelines trying to make up your mind to give our hobby a shot, I can think of few better ways to give it a try. They can be reached at[masked]-0379. Our meetup is not the sponsor, but I would not be shocked if some of our people would join in on their own volition. Go give it a shot! They have a Cafe with bakery goods and treats, too.
results.name: Game Night by Barnes & Noble - Learn Splendor

results.description:
Kick-off the CMU International Film Festival’s TENTH ANNIVERSARY season with a 2016 Oscar-nominee for Best Foreign Film which will challenge you about the gray areas of war.


JOIN US!  
Stick around after the screening to celebrate the launch of our 10th season with our Opening Night Reception and enjoy lively conversations with fellow film lovers and Pittsburghers!

Co-Sponsored by CMU's Division of Student Affairs (DOSA) and Pitt's Global Studies Center.

EVENT INFO HERE | BUY TICKETS HERE

Find FREE parking at the Forbes Avenue Parking Lot after 5pm!


FILM DESCRIPTION  
“A War doesn’t seek to break new ground in the ongoing cinematic investigation of the Afghanistan conflict; rather, it scrutinizes the ground on which it stands with consummate sensitivity and detail.” –Guy Lodge, Variety

Good versus evil, right versus wrong, one coalition versus another. War, it seems, should be black and white, but what happens when a commander’s decision to save one of his men results in the death of innocent civilians? Who is to blame? Whose lives are more valuable? This is the gray area inhabited by Academy Award nominated A War. Intertwining intense battle scenes with courtroom consequences and intimate scenes of a family struggling to cope with their father’s absence, this is a war film for audiences who don’t like war films, and no two viewers will walk away with the same conclusion.


TRAILER

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qil14JEoPzU

Reception & Film Location

This event is General Admission (open seating) and takes place inside the Jared L. Cohen University Center (where the café areas are also located) next to the tennis courts.   And if you were standing on Forbes facing the main campus (near the bus shelter at Forbes & Morewood), you would see the famous 'Walking to the Sky' sculpture (where people appear to walking up a 10-story angled pole) in front of you, and the Cohen University Center would be very long building to your left. The McConomy Auditorium is on the 1st floor of the Cohen University Center. Please print out this campus map before you go http://www.cmu.edu/homeimages/campus-map/cmu_mapcolor_8x11.pdf -- the Cohen University Center is Building #13 on this map. 


Here is what the McConomy Auditorium looks like inside http://www.cmu.edu/cohon-university-center/reserve-space/event-spaces/mcconomy.html

CMU International Film Festival For the complete festival schedule and more info, including trailers of all of the films during CMU International Film Festival’s TENTH ANNIVERSARY season (March 17 - April 3, 2016), please visit http://www.cmu.edu/faces/index.html
results.name: ‘A War’ (Denmark, 2015) + Opening Night Reception!
