Free Classes!!

Are you one of the too-many homeowners who find yourself stuck each year trying to eradicate your dandelion "garden?" I know digging the roots out might not seem like your first choice method, but, after a good long rain, when the ground is soft, they will come out much easier, and you can make SO MUCH medicine from the pesky roots! I will explain the many ways Dandelion can help to heal us. Excellent kidney remedy. Great for skin. And so much more!

Feel free to join the Wednesday series at any time! Check out each meetup page for more details about what I'll be covering at each class!

Class will be held indoors in the Community Room at the Bridgeville Library, unless we feel up for briefly going outside to check out a few plants!

Pre-registration required. RSVP here through Meetup.com, or call the Bridgeville Library at[masked]-3737.

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."

results.description:
Spring Volleyball Leagues! Choose from two great locations and have fun this season.

Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends or as a full team. 

League Options:  All Coed 6v6 unless otherwise noted

Tuesdays, Dinker (upper intermediate) @ Cool Springs - starts 3/22

Wednesdays, Bumper (rec/lower intermediate) @ Cool Springs - starts 3/23

Tuesdays, Dinker or Bumper @ Monroeville - starts 3/30

Wednesdays, Dinker 4v4 Coed @ Monroeville - starts 3/31

$49/player. What's included in the price? 

• 7 weeks of regular season plus one week of playoffs 
• Paid monitor for Bumper and paid referee for Dinker 
• 4 v 4 as noted 
• Three games per match. One match per week.
• Championship t-shirts/trophies 
• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar 
• We will not place more than 7 players on a roster. Most individual team rosters have 4 to 6 players. 

Format 
6v6 (Coed 6's: 3 Males/3 Females). 4v4 (2 Males/2 Females). You may always play with more than the minimum number of females. For the first season, we may play with different ratios.


When are we playing? 
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times will rotate between 7:00 - 9:00 each week. A full season schedule and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2.


Playing surface and what to wear: 
Wood Floors at Cool Springs. Hardwood at Cool Springs. Rubberized floor at Monroeville. Athletic shoes required.

These leagues are happening! 
Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. So go ahead and sign up to play!


Full Team Registration 
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 8. And yes, you can pay for all 8 here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP.


When will I find out which team I'm on? 
Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season. 

Don't have PayPal? You may register through sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site. 

If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask. 
Call:[masked] 
E-mail: [masked]


All registrations made through this Meetup event agree to the terms and conditions found on sportsmonster.net.

results.description:
In our last meet up we talked about working with our angels. In addition there are an infinite number of helpers on the Other Side known as “spirit guides” who are as varied as the people in your life and serve all kinds of short and long term purposes.

In our next meet up we will have a fun and interactive session on the different ways to communicate with our guides. We will discuss tools you can use immediately to distinguish the subtle voices of your guides from your intellect.

We will discuss the first and most important of the guides which are the Nature Spirits comprised of earth, water, fire and air. The Nature spirits help you get grounded. They are wonderfully therapeutic and relieve stress, anxiety, sleeplessness and worry when we connect with them.

Getting to know your guides and learning to work with them is exciting and will make your life magical and stress free. They want to help you whenever they can and are simply waiting for you to invite them to get involved.

After this meet up you will be able to get them involved in your life.

Look forward to seeing there!

Blessings,

Joe

results.description:
It's hump day, and for $5, you can celebrate the midweek point with some rockin' blues. Show starts at 7:30 p.m., so you'll be home and in bed early!

Pittsburgh's Charlie Hustle and The Grifters will open the night in support of Nicnos, who are on tour from Oklahoma supporting their new CD. Howler's is a smoking establishment, but there is NO SMOKING in the performance side of the venue.

About Nicnōs
Nicnōs delivers a show that exudes high energy, strong vocals, and talented instrumentation that will intrigue you. This five piece band from Oklahoma City is on the rise and has played with REO Speedwagon, FUEL, Creedence Clearwater, Jonathan Tyler and the Northern Lights, The Revivalists, .38 Special, Blackberry Smoke and more. Be ready to fall in love with their original sound, enjoy their showmanship and feed off their energy! Hear them at http://www.thenicnos.com/music.html About Charlie Hustle & The Grifters
Charlie Hustle & the Grifters brings together four Pittsburgh musicians under the banner of heady musical synergy. Its members include guitarist Peter Flynn and upright bassist Trish Imbrogno of The Grifters, drummer Dave Varasse from one of Pittsburgh's premier funk bands, the Old E Allstars, and guitarist Patrick Varine. The quartet comes together and forms like Voltron! ... if Voltron consisted of two guitars, upright bass, drums and a fond desire to blend rock, folk and the blues into a gritty, tasty stew. Hear them at https://archive.org/details/CharlieHustleAndTheGrifters?and%5B0%5D=CharlieHustleAndTheGrifters

This is the  1st actual lesson for this group. Last week, we established the level and  time and day of the lessons.

This week we will start with  a mini conversation based on the Lebanese Mini dialogues sent by PDF and Quizlets A!, A2 A4  greetings, classroom vocab and colors. We will then go over the non connector letters and the corresponding sight words. Students will take turns writing words, reading them and saying their meanings. Students will challenge eachothers this way.

We will close by introducing the new group of letters and sight words. then assigning homework.

This system is based on the FLipped classroom concept where students prepare for the material ahead of time and use what they have learned in the classroom.

See you on Wednesday.

Roula

results.description:
There is no requirement to register and no cost. All participants must be well. Please do bring your baby with you.

Pregnant mothers, currently breastfeeding mothers, mothers who are pumping and bottlefeeding, mothers who have breastfed in the past are all welcome to participate.

Meetings are led by a lactation consultant from Heritage Valley Sewickley. There is a scale available for weighing babies. Some meetings focus on a particular topic, but generally there is no specific topic. Specific topics can be addressed if requested by group participants.

Meetings of the Breastfeeding Moms Network are normally held on the 2nd and 4th Thursday evening of the month--except November and December when it is only the 2nd Thursday evening.

Storkbites is for all new mothers with a baby under a year old. Those meetings are on Tuesday mornings and moms can attend whether they are breast or formula feeding their babies.
results.how_to_find_us: Meetings are held on the 6th floor of the hospital in the Maternal Child Health classroom. There are blue signs posted on the evenings when there are meetings, to help you find the classroom.
results.name: Breastfeeding Moms Network

results.description:
This is a discussion group EN FRANCAIS for those (intermediate and higher) wishing to perfect their conversational French.

I will bring materials for learning/teaching.  This will include 1 song, but there will also be a chapter from:

• La grammaire à l'oeuvre (John Barson-Stanford) - many consider to be the best grammar/conversation book ever written (I have French friends who use it for review).  John Barson was interested in using science fiction, art and other unusual 'gaming' techniques in perfecting grammar and expression.


• Le français Départ/Arrivée (Rassias - Dartmouth) - another classic text.  Rassias was by nature a theater person, and originator of a unique language learning method - very much "in your face" and physical-response oriented.


I will also focus on practicing authentic French phrases and pronunciation.

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.
results.how_to_find_us: Nous serons à l'intérieur
results.name: Int-Adv French Conversation @ Wexford Panera Breads

results.description:
I'm getting great feedback on the Mindful Movement (Qigong - Meditation) Class and wanted to see if i can get any interest for a 4 week Thursday Evening class. Space is limited to 5 prepaid, preregistered Students. Please message me if you are interested or have any questions.


Looking for a new practice to Reduce Stress? Do You Want a Holistic Method for balance, flexibility and mental focus? Qigong is an ancient practice of very, slow movements, conscious breath-work, and visualization/meditation. It is performed sitting, standing or lying down. Qi means life energy and breath, the essence of life. Gong has many meanings including work, skill or benefits. The many benefits of Qigong including balance, mental focus and flexibility along with:

1.  Overall well-being and improved health

2.  Clear and tranquil mind

3.  Deeper, more restorative sleep

4.  Increased energy, including sexual vitality and fertility

5.  Improved circulation

6.  Eliminates toxins

7.  Happy Attitude

8.  More efficient metabolism

9.  Greater physiological control

10.  Brighter eyes

11.  Intuition and creativity

12.  Spiritual effects; synchronicity, meaningful coincidences…

Routines taught may promote weight loss and improved digestion.

Kelly Haywiser leads her students through various routines that can be repeated along with adding time for meditation in a 4 week class. Class length is normally 60 - 75 minutes. Wear comfortable, loose fitting clothing. Yoga mat required for lying or sitting positions. She recommends bare feet or slip-on canvas shoes with a good rubber sole. Advise Kelly prior to class of any restrictions. Call to preregister and prepay[masked] or go to submit any questions www.holisticapproach4life.com to contact her. Kelly Haywiser; LMT, RMT and certified health coach has been practicing and teaching this modality for over 20 years.

Cost is $56.00 for the 4 week class.


How to Get to Hidden Valley --- If you are coming from Bridgeville on Boyce Road. Follow Boyce to Red Light of Mayview. Continue straight. Cross over the railroad tracks and make the 1st right (by the storage facility) on to Hidden Valley Drive -- like you are going back to the Golf Course. Go straight and park on the left hand side infront of the Building. Come in the farthest door on your left. Go down the steps and follow the signs to Hidden Valley Massage. At the very end of the hall on the left side. Come straight back to the room.  This is the building in the back by the Golf Course. This is where Calabrias use to be.

Cancellation- No Refund Policy. I need to have 5 paid-Committed attendees to make this class a go. There are room fees and time away from my practice. If i have less than 5 - This class will be canceled prior to start and all money will be refunded. If we have 5 paid attendees and the class is a go; (and you must skip a class or 2); I'm sorry I will not be able to refund your money as your money will have been already used to rent the room.

If a Go:

Thursday, March 24th

Thursday, March 31st

Thursday, April 7th

Thursday, April 14th

results.description:
An advance welcome to you – our prospective guest…

Perhaps you’ve been thinking about going to a Toastmasters meeting for awhile.

Maybe you’re not quite certain what to expect, and so you’ve hesitated.

Given that fear of public speaking has ranked as the top phobia for quite some time, you’ve got plenty of company! At the same time, the most important skill, and it is indeed a “skill” -- not something that one is born with, or is “automatically” comfortable and effective for anyone -- is communication.

How we communicate influences most every aspect of our personal and professional lives. Wherever you happen to be in your communications process, the supportive environment of our club can make a positive difference. As renowned and respected motivational speaker Les Brown has maintained throughout his impressive career, “Practice makes improvement.”

You may notice that the emphasis is NOT upon perfection, but rather, upon effort and growth, over the course of time. We hope that you will consider Club 1104 – Penn Hills Toastmasters as a place where you can feel comfortable and encouraged as you embark upon your path to improved communication.

See you at the next meeting!

http://1104.toastmastersclubs.org/

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."
results.name: Fight Club: Ready ... Set ... Action!

results.description:
Hello everyone!

Last week was a blast!  Six of us played prohibition era gangsters running whiskey to speakeasies, exerting influence, flexing muscle, and doing back ally deals in Bootleggers.  Redbeard pulled off an impressive last turn come from behind move to nip victory at the wire.  I can see this game hitting the table a few times a year.  

Some of the games played were Steampunk Rally and Above and Below.

This week's theme is Spiel des Jahres games!

The Spiel des Jahres (German for Game of the Year) is an award for board and card games, created in 1978 with the stated purpose of rewarding excellence in game design, and promoting top-quality games in the German market. It is thought that the existence and popularity of the award is one of the major drivers of the quality of games coming out of Germany. A Spiel des Jahres nomination can increase the typical sales of a game from 500–3000 copies to around 10,000; and the winner can usually expect to sell 300,000 to 500,000 copies.


Some Spiel des Jahres winners and nominees in my collection include...Broom Service, Orleans, Elysium, Splendor, Concordia, Istanbul, Bruges, Kingdom Builder, 7 Wonders, Dominion, Dixit, Pandemic, Stone Age, and Ticket to Ride.  


If any of those games interest you please let me know down in the chat and I will be sure to bring them along.  

Looking forward to Friday night, hope to see you there!

Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play...

Party games like:  Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like:  Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico, Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like:  Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like:  Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, and Munchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans.


See you soon!

Russ.

results.description:
What is a TurnOn?

Be your real uncensored self. Say the uncomfortable thing. Connect with a turned-on community.

TurnOn: [turn on] v. sensations occurring in the body

  • Increased body heat

  • Tingling and chills

  • Flushing cheeks

  • Feeling awake and alive


We find that TurnOn is the ignition that leads to a more of what we really want in life. It is the first step to knowing what's possible. And it comes when we get real about the powerful stuff of relationships, Orgasm, intimacy, desire, etc.

And so we host this event specifically designed to let you to feel TurnOn. You can experience exhilarating, energizing, often-suppressed feelings through a series of guided, round-robin-style communication games. You can play at whatever level you like, and share as much or as little as you’re comfortable with.

Come express yourself and gain new insight into yourself and others, while engaging with cool, open minded people committed to real connection.

For a sample of the evening's games, check out this clip from a recent episode on the Chopra Network: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E&list=PLF72E690B227EFAC1&index=22

TurnOn leads to authenticity and authenticity leads to the kind of connection we hope for around the globe. Come feel it for yourself.

Singles & couples welcome. Invite your friends.
Please arrive on time. Doors will be locked 15 minutes after start time to create a safe environment. $10 at the door
results.name: TurnOn (Communication Games)

In class we will devote time to conversation, improvisation, and some grammar points.

results.description:
What is this class? 

This class will teach you to solder or help you practice your skills if they are a little rusty. We will guide you through the process of building an Arduino from a kit. Kits will be provided and in the end you will go home with your brand new DIY Arduino ready to make your project dreams come true.

Visit Eventbrite  to sign up for this class.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-solder-class-arduino-tickets-21725699151?utm-medium=discovery&utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-source=cp&utm-term=listing 

Recommended Age Group: 8-99 (kids must be accompanied by adults)


Did I mention you get free pizza for lunch! 

Special Discount: If you buy the soldering class, you get 50% off the Introductory Arduino Programming Class (Intro to C) on April 2nd (The next Saturday). Email [masked] for the discount code if you plan to buy the Programming Class. 

For $60 you will have the knowledge to Solder, Your own Arduino, and the skills to program an Arduino, and your own traffic lights with sensors. 

Programming Class Link: http://www.meetup.com/HackPittsburgh/events/229343022/


This class is in a series of  upcoming monthly classes at HackPittsburgh:

• Basic Electricity and Electronics (if you missed it, will be repeated soon)

• Learn to Solder (This class)

• Basic Arduino Programming (April 2nd. See below)

http://www.meetup.com/HackPittsburgh/events/229343022/

• Advanced Arduino Programming (TBD)

• Sensors Sensors Sensors! (TBD)

• Motor Control (TBD)

• Basic Electronics Part 2: Semiconductors and op-amps (TBD)

While attendance at one class isn’t required to attend any of the others, with this series of classes you can build your own arduino microcontroller and learn how to do cool things with it. As an added bonus, we will be providing discount codes at each class for the following classes. So, the more you learn, the more you save!

Visit Eventbrite for all the details and to sign up for this class.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-solder-class-arduino-tickets-21725699151?utm-medium=discovery&utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-source=cp&utm-term=listing

results.description:
Price - Donations appreciated

This event is open to everyone, no membership required!!

Benefits of Reiki:
-Increases energy
-Relieves stress, anxiety, and fears
-Restores inner balance
-Increases mental focus and clarity
-Releases old pains and trauma
-Improves injury or surgery recovery time
-Management of chronic conditions

This circle is an opportunity to plug in each month to the Reiki healing energy in a group setting. It gives those who have never experienced Reiki a chance to see, feel and know what it is all about. This circle focuses our attention on ourselves, our well-being, success, balance, enlightenment and happiness. 

Reiki is a technique for relaxation and stress reduction that also promotes healing. It’s administered by laying on hands while the client is fully clothed. Though Reiki is Spiritual in nature, it is not a Religion. Doors close at 1:00 pm, please arrive prior to then.

To contact Kitsy visit www.revkeh.com or email [masked]

Take your yoga practice outdoors...no mats required! Our Outdoor Discovery School instructors will guide you on a rejuvenating 3 to 4 mile hike on the South Ridge of North Park. During the hike, we'll break occasionally to take a few standing poses and tension tamers, led by experienced yoga instructor, Jen. Our yoga hike will conclude with a few standing stretches and a seated guided relaxation/meditation.

This outing is suitable for those new to yoga, and is designed for all levels of fitness, so come join us for an energizing experience you won't want to miss.

venue.name: Boyce-Mayview Park (Ardolino's Pizza parking lot trailhead)

results.description:
Spring has already Sprung!

Almost exactly a year ago, we held our very first plant walk at this same location.... and the Coltsfoot was just barely beginning to awaken from its slumber!

This year, Coltsfoot is ALREADY OUT!  And so are the first Spring Beauties!

So let us not wait any longer!  Come on out this weekend, and learn how to identify the wild edible & medicinal plants of Boyce-Mayview Park (and always a handful of plants which are just lovely to look at!)

There is already a wide variety of things starting to poke their heads up out of the soil, so come out now before they get much bigger!  Now is an excellent time to learn to ID them while they are still babes.

And as usual, I'm asking for donations of $10, but if you don't have the money, please don't hesitate to tag along for the ride anyway!  (Or just offer whatever you comfortably can!)

Many Thanks in advance!  I usually try to cap the plant walks around 15-20 people, intentionally because large groups can't always hear and see everything as closely, so save your spot now (but only if you're sure you can make it, so everyone who can gets the chance!)  And as always, kids & teens are free!
results.name: Edible & Medicinal Plant Walk at Boyce-Mayview!

This is a Photo 101 Course, It is a low key, very small group that I think is a fun personal way to learn the basics of your SLR camera including F-Stop, Shutter speed and ISO.  All levels of photo experience can learn from this class so don't worry if you just got a camera or you have been shooting for years.  With the small group approach all levels of experience can get individual questions and attention.

If you haven't been to Phipps before you will love all the great photo opportunities.  

Admission will be the responsibility of individual members.

Terry

results.description:
Please join us for a walk in Frick Park on Saturday, March 26th at 3PM!  We'll be walking to the East End Food Co-Op Cafe after our walk in the park if anyone wants to join us. 

We'll meet at the Reynolds Street Park traffic circle.  It's across from the Frick Art museum and near the Cafe at Frick.  There are two stone benches underneath two stone signs for Frick Park.  The stone signs are embedded in a stone wall looking down on the two benches.  Between the signs is the gatehouse entrance we'll be using to enter Frick Park.

results.description:
Let us come together to build a community of meditators and spread the benefits of meditation among Pittsburghers. So come and join with us in a Joyful meditation for health and happiness and tell the whole city "I Meditate Pittsburgh." :-)

There are no prerequisites and all above 12 yrs of age are welcome to join. Consider telling your friends and bring them along.

Event will be simple. We will start with some introduction to meditation, do some gentle stretches and have a guided meditation with the group. At the end we will share our experiences and open floor for questions and discussions. You can also ask any questions you may have in the beginning or email us now.

Please RSVP for the event and we look forward to seeing you.

results.description:
Hey everyone,


Let's meetup and play some singles games from 9:15am - 11:00am. We will warm up for 10 minutes, and then play some sets of singles games.

IF you don't want to play singles games then please sign up for a different session.


This session is for intermediates only (level 3.5 and above) and will be limited to 4 players.

If you don't know your playing level, click this link to find out: http://www.usta.com/Adult-Tennis/USTA-League/ntrp/

*For the singles games: We will adhere to the USTA guidelines when it comes to rest: 60-seconds break between the first changeover; 90-seconds break between all subsequent changeovers; and 2 minutes break between sets.*

Look forward to seeing you on the court!
results.name: SUNDAY Morning Tennis: SINGLES GAMES Only-INTERMEDIATES (3.5 and above)

results.description:
YES, this is Easter Sunday.   

For those of us who don't do a whole lot on Easter, it's a perfect day to go sightseeing. Lake Wilhem is fast becoming one of the largest, local Bald Eagle areas. Last week it was noted that 47 eagles were counted in one day by a visitor.

 I'm not promising anything but it would be a great, low visitor day. As long as it's not raining, I'm driving up. It's about an hour from Cranberry and an hour, fifteen minutes on the back road. 

You can research Lake Wilhem or Goddard State Park if you want more information. If I get any RSVPS, we can arrange a location to meet up.

The Maurice Goddard State park site has great downloadable bird charts, checklists and maps.  

http://www.dcnr.state.pa.us/stateparks/findapark/mauricekgoddard/index.htm?tab=Maps#Maps

It seems like there will be lots of subjects to photograph.   

Rain date:  following day.
results.name: Bald Eagle Sightseeing

group.name: The Pittsburgh Photo Safari Meetup Group

results.description:
Join the Pittsburgh Change Ringing Guild in making a joyful noise as the Southminster congregation leaves church on Sunday afternoon.

As Sunday service ringing is our public event, non-ringers are more than welcome to visit and check out what we do. However, you may not have an opportunity to learn or practice bell handling skills.
Learning bell handling skills is best suited for either our weekly Thursday night practices or one on one instruction set up with an experienced bell ringer.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter Southminster church by the doors between the church and the middle school.  Either walk to the 4th floor or take the elevator to the 4th floor.  Turn left and continue up the stairs to the Bell Tower.
results.name: Service Ringing at Southminster

results.description:
Join us for my first ever Easter Co-Ed Brunch Buffet & Party on Sunday on March 27th, at 1:00 PM. 

NOTE:  This event is also open to anyone who doesn't celebrate Easter, as well. Everyone is welcome!

Lisa & Rob will provide a ham, turkey, and mashed potatoes, along with soft drinks, and a variety of alcoholic beverages, including wine & champagne (Moët). Deena, who is co-hosting the event, will bring banana chocolate chip bread and one other dessert. 

SIDE DISHES, APPETIZERS, SNACKS, & DESSERTS 
WELCOME. FEEL FREE TO BYOB YOUR FAVORITE 
BEVERAGE, ALTHOUGH SOME DRINKS PROVIDED!

Since Lisa & Rob are providing the main course , we're asking people to please bring a side dish, appetizer, snack, or dessert to share with the group. Coffee, creamer & sugar will be provided with desert. Thanks!

Lisa & Deena will email the exact street address to everyone who RSVPs "Yes" the day before the event. *PLEASE MAKE SURE TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL! 

PARKING:  Everyone can Park in the church parking lot across the street. The church allows the neighborhood to park there.

NOTE:  THIS EVENT IS CROSS-POSTED ON BURGH ADULTS AND PITTSBURGH DINING N'AT AS WELL. 


Bring Husbands, Friends, Boyfriends or Anything in Between. Singles are also Welcome. 

Looking forward to socializing. 

Lisa & Deena
results.name: Easter Co-Ed Brunch Buffet and Party, at Lisa & Rob's House

group.name: Pittsburgh Silver Screen Dinner & Film Group

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the ones playing games.
results.name: Play Eurogames!

results.description:
From frank the admin (Big Kahuna).  This is a fun non-hosted event.  There are normally 30-40 people in the Audience that you can hang out with and meet and enjoy the show.  I've been here twice and it's a darn good time and for 5 Bucks it's worth it!

Bonus Stage at Arcade Comedy Theatre from 7pm-9pm $5 Tickets, just show up!

Catch some fresh, cutting edge improv comedy at our weekly showcase. Each week, the Arcade features two of their house teams alongside a special guest troupe.

3 Improv teams of about 6 to 8 and there's usually 30 to 40 in the audience. This is very fun!

http://arcadecomedytheater.com/bonusstage/

Something Fun and cheap.

Parking downtown can be on the Street if you can find any or in the garages where the weekend rate is cheaper.

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

results.description:
Just a reminder that Bootcamp starts Monday! Details below or message me. Hope you can join us!


Ladies-- Thank you for the interest in this group! Bootcamp is in session starting Monday, March 28 through Sunday, April 17! We'll be following the 21 Day Fix program, which includes 7 30-minute at home workouts (requiring a light and heavy set of dumbbells) and a meal plan based on color-coded containers. I'll set up a private Facebook group for participants for daily check-ins, motivation and support. I started doing the program after my first son was born in October 2013 and have been doing it post-baby #2, who arrived in October 2015. I LOVE the workouts and the meal plan and find that it's perfect for busy moms-- 30 minute workouts at home (that you can do even with the kiddos hanging around) and awesome recipes that the whole family enjoys (and let's you stop feeling like an unappreciated short order cook). I'm a lawyer by day and mom all the time and this program has allowed me to get back into and stay in shape with minimal time and effort. If you have the program already, awesome! If not, I'll include links below. **Please note that I am a Beachbody coach (essentially a rep) and do earn commissions from sales, half of which will be donated to Magee's NICU for March and April. Back story-- our first son arrived early and spent some time in the NICU after birth. Our experience there, while emotionally taxing and difficult, was pretty amazing and, as a result, my husband and I are committed to supporting the NICU and other parents with children currently there. I'm a coach for the fun of it so thought that donating commissions might be a nice, additional way to support the NICU.

In any event, I hope that you'll join us for this program! If you have questions, please email me at [masked]. --Lauren

21 Day Fix (Workout DVDs and meal plan; no Shakeology):
http://www.teambeachbody.com/shop/-/shopping/21DayFix?referringRepId=962997

21 Day Fix (Workout DVDs, meal plan + Shakeology):
http://www.teambeachbody.com/shop/-/shopping/BCP21D160?referringRepId=962997
(Shakeology is a daily nutritional shake that you can use as a meal or a snack. I use it as a snack and love it-- it keeps my cravings under control, is a great go-to when I'm running after the kids and need something quick and tastes like a milkshake; happy to provide further information regarding it!)

results.description: Perhaps the most underestimated line in the bible is 1 John 4:8 where it says "God is love." What doesn't that verse say? It doesn't say that God is a barrel-chested white man with a long flowing white beard sitting on a throne, looking like King Triton from The Little Mermaid, ready to cast us into a burning pit of fire if he disapproves of our behaviors. What does that verse say? Religions might make it about Big Daddy In the Sky, but every spiritual discipline agrees that LOVE answers everything. In this group we define what love really is and look at the teachings of other time-honored spiritual philosophies.

results.description:
Regarded by many as Henry James's finest work, and a lucid tragedy exploring the distance between money and happiness, 

The Portrait of a Lady

 contains an introduction by Philip Horne in Penguin Classics. When Isabel Archer, a beautiful, spirited American, is brought to Europe by her wealthy aunt Touchett, it is expected that she will soon marry. But Isabel, resolved to enjoy the freedom that her fortune has opened up and to determine her own fate, does not hesitate to turn down two eligible suitors. Then she finds herself irresistibly drawn to Gilbert Osmond. Charming and cultivated, Osmond sees Isabel as a rich prize waiting to be taken. Beneath his veneer of civilized behaviour, Isabel discovers cruelty and a stifling darkness. In this portrait of a 'young woman affronting her destiny', Henry James created one of his most magnificent heroines, and a story of intense poignancy.
results.name: ***Discussion FIRST 1/2***  Portrait of A Lady by Henry James

The film was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film 1991 and is considered to belong among the best Czechoslovak films ever. It as directed by Jan Sverak; his father, Zdenek, developed the screenplay. It tells the story of Zdenek Sverak's childhood in a postwar Prague suburb. Screening of this high quality digitalized version of the film with English subtitles, will be a great opportunity for all Czech, Slovak and English-speaking movie lovers in Pittsburgh. This event is dedicated to Zdenek Sverak's 80th birthday.

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2015 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.
results.how_to_find_us: Hard to miss us, look for the Mah Jong sets!
results.name: Mah Jong in Shadyside! (Note:  No beginner class tonight!)

results.description:
Join us for our March users group meeting with Eugene Meidinger.  Please note the time change.  We're starting a little later.  The meeting will start at 5:30.

The Power BI Suite has been around for less than a year and is changing every week. However, the technology behind it has been around for years now. It can be confusing trying to understand PowerThis and PowerThat. In this session, we will cover the different parts of PowerBI and what makes it new and exciting. We will look at how PowerBI fits into the existing Microsoft BI ecosystem. Finally, we will go over the process of creating and publishing a dashboard.

About Eugene: Eugene is a database developer at All-Lines / Lantek. He has been working with customers to provide SQL solutions for over 4 years. He is certified in Querying and Administering SQL Server
results.name: Why PowerBI? Introducing Microsoft’s new BI tool

results.description:
Join us for our next meeting of Welsh Book Club, where we'll be discussing Here Be Dragons, the first book in Sharon Kay Penman's Welsh Princes trilogy. 

Thirteenth-century Wales is a divided country, ever at the mercy of England's ruthless, power-hungry King John. Llewelyn, Prince of North Wales, secures an uneasy truce by marrying the English king's beloved illegitimate daughter, Joanna, who slowly grows to love her charismatic and courageous husband. But as John's attentions turn again and again to subduing Wales---and Llewelyn---Joanna must decide where her love and loyalties truly lie.

The turbulent clashes of two disparate worlds and the destinies of the individuals caught between them spring to life in this magnificent novel of power and passion, loyalty and lies. The book that began the trilogy that includes Falls the Shadow and The Reckoning, Here Be Dragons brings thirteenth-century England, France, and Wales to tangled, tempestuous life.

 Order your copy here: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0312382456
results.name: Welsh Book Club

FYI: Climbing the Cathedral from 7pm to 8pm and then Meet at Hemingway's Cafe Back Room for a bite to eat and a Beverage at 8:15 ish...

It's our last Cathedral Climb of the season, might as well celebrate!
YEP, Last Climb of the Season, I won't be posting Cathedral Climbs till November after today, it's HIKING & BIKING SEASON!  So this is your LAST CHANCE TO CLIMB w me ;-).  As a REWARD we are going to Hemingway's Cafe on 3911 Forbes Avenue to CELEBRATE another awesome year of realizing GRAVITY SUCKS!

Made it through another WINTER climbing the 36 Stories of the Cathedral of Learning for an hour, hopefully pushing yourself and getting better at fighting gravity.  So we're going to climb for one LAST TIME and then go to Hemingway's Cafe for Food and Libations - BEER or other beverages!  Now is the Start of HIKING & BIKING season!

Climb the Cathedral of Learning Stairs for an Hour, then Hemingway's!

Meet at 6:50pm by the benches by the 1st Floor Cathedral of Learning Elevators. We climb the Back Stairwell (Stairwell A) starting exactly at 7pm, then climb as many floors as we can in a hour taking the elevator DOWN to rest and do it again. Couch Potatoes can usually do it 1-2 times people that are in shape can do it 3-5 times, super shape 4-7 times. Then we walk to Hemingway's Cafe on 3911 Forbes Avenue and catch a bite because we earned it!

GREAT FOOD: Hemingway's Cafe on 3911 Forbes Avenue and catch a bite because we earned it!

Parking is on street, FREE after 6pm on S. Bellefield, S. Craig and S. Dithridge Streets.

Wear light clothing and put coats on 36th floor and keep your valuables on you. Water Bottle or Camelback recommended.  It gets HOT in the Stairwells!

My phone for TEXT contact is[masked] remember I will be driving in from 40 mins away so will respond after my car is parked!

results.description:
Join us for a 2-hour session of indoor volleyball open gym! You'll get a ton of playing time in a well-organized event. Our host will check players in, divide players into teams, and make sure that everything runs smoothly. All you have to do is show up ready to play!

Pricing:

• $7 - RSVP online and pay in advance because you know you are attending. (online rsvp closes at 4:30 pm!)

• $8.50 - RSVP and pay 50 cents via PayPal and $8 cash at the event if you are pretty sure you are attending (note the 50 cents is non-refundable)

• $10 - Show up and play - be sure to check online to make sure there is room!

What to Wear: We are playing indoors on a rubberized all-sport surface. Most players wear volleyball-specific shoes, but gym shoes are also allowed. Please bring your shoes and change into them at the facility. This will help keep the floor clean of dirt and water.

What to Expect: Show up early! The games will begin at the time posted for this event. Players can start checking in with the event host as early as 15 minutes before the scheduled start time. If a court is available, you may begin warming up before the event begins. We limit play to 42 players per evening, which is 3 teams of 7 players per court. If we have 3 teams on a court, winners stay once and then shuffle out so everyone gets to play. If less people are in attendance, we divide based on who is there and mix things up half way through the session.

Level of Play: This event is open to all levels of play. We do our best to create even teams so that games are well-matched. Our ideal scenario is having one court of higher skilled players and one court of more recreational players. There are no referees, so players need to play with sportsmanship and make their own calls. We aim to make everyone feel welcome at these events.

Facility Information: Monroeville Sports Center is located at 855 Macbeth Drive in Monroeville. Parking should be ample in the free lot.

Minimum number of players and playing formats. This event needs a minimum of 12 people (not including the host) signed up before the start of the event in order to run. An email notification will be sent if we cancel. Refunds or credits will be issued if we cancel the event. Sign up early to encourage more people to sign up!!

Do Your Part! Help us keep an accurate guest count! If you RSVP, we're counting on you to be there. If you change your mind about playing or your guest count changes, please update your RSVP. No-Shows will be marked on your account. If space is tight, we hold RSVP spots 10 minutes into advertised start and then open spots to walk-ups.

Requirements to play: This is an adult volleyball group. You must be 19 older. Males and females of all skill levels are welcome to play. There is no required gender ratio. Players are expected to conduct themselves with good sportsmanship.

What's included in the price? Your payment helps to cover the rental costs, the hourly pay for your event host, and ensures a well-organized event.

Questions? Post your question in the comments section of this meetup and the event host or one of our organizers will reply. You can also message the organizers directly through meetup. Or, give us a call M-F 8:00am-12:30pm:[masked]-7130.

results.description:
PR people hate pitching. Reporters/editors/writers hate being pitched. But here we are, driving each other crazy day after day anyway. How about we stop that? 

Join PRSA Pittsburgh and ONA Pittsburgh on Wednesday, March 30 from 5:30-8:30 p.m. at Sharp Edge Bistro (922 Penn Ave.) for a no-pitch, no sell night of….talking! Of learning from each other! Of having a drink and getting to know each other! 

Use the hashtag #PRSAONA (leading up to the event or when you arrive) to share your thoughts or suggestions on what can be improved or should be avoided when working with either PR professionals or members of the media. 

From 6:[masked] p.m., we'll have a little fun and share these tips with a moderated discussion between PRSA's Steve Radick and ONA's Kim Lyons so that we can take some advice from each other!
results.name: Have drinks with PRSA

results.description:
Christian Gass will lead this session, which will provide an introduction to the basic geographic, cartographic, and geographic information systems (GIS) concepts essential to working with data in digital mapping and web maps. These concepts will be explained within the context of working with Open Street Map (OSM), a key global, open geospatial data source, within FOSS geo tools like QGIS, Mapbox, CartoDB, and leaflet.

Location-  Wean Hall Room 4623.
Wean Hall is the large concrete building just off the southern 'Mall' of the campus. Room 4623 is on the 4th floor. Parking is available in the Gates Hillman Garage, the Forbes Ave Garage, or along Frew St (on the Schenley Park side of campus).
results.name: SUDS Workshop: Web Mapping

results.description:
Free Classes!!

Curious about foraging & using weeds, trees, and other plants for food and medicine? Not sure where to start? At this class, I will discuss how a knowledge of even a handful of common weeds and plants can make us more confident when outdoors. I'll describe the many benefits wild foods have compared to their domestic counterparts, and I will describe where and how to find them. These plants are of much importance in this region, & I will explain why we need to help restore and protect the natural areas of our community so that they (and we) will thrive. This class makes a wonderful Intro. course to my April & May Plant Walks in the area! Come learn the importance of these plants, and within weeks you can see many of them first-hand on the trails!

Feel free to join this free Wednesday series at any time! Check out each meetup page for more details about what I'll be covering at each class!

Class will be held indoors in the Community Room at the Bridgeville Library, unless we feel up for briefly going outside to check out a few plants!

Pre-registration required. RSVP here through Meetup.com, or call the Bridgeville Library at[masked]-3737.

http://bridgevillelibrary.org/

Don't Miss Out On Pittsburgh‘s Most Exciting New Dating Concept... Play Dating

This spontaneous event is a combination of Game Night and Speed Dating. Join other fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable party like no other!

Here is how it works…

~ Upon arrival you will be greeted by the friendliest host you’ve ever met and given a name tag with a random number, as well as a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet

~ Time to Play: every 6 minutes you will receive a mystery message with a secret task to carry out with your 6 minute date

~ At the end of the night let us know the number(s) of the people you would like to see again. ~ If the feeling’s mutual, we will exchange your contact information. Keep in mind that you will only be able to choose up to 5 people for potential matches.

Common Questions:

What if I don’t have a match?

Even if you don’t have a match, we’ll give you the the contact information for those who are interested in you. You never know what might happen!

100% Match Guarantee -- We GUARANTEE that you will have a match at our event. If you don't, then your next event is on us! 

Can I come alone?

Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What are the age ranges?

This event will cater mostly to single professionals in their 20s and 30s however we have events for all kinds of demographics. Check out our Meetup Group Relationship Ready Singles - Pittsburgh for more coming events (http://www.meetup.com/relationship-ready-singles-burgh)

How is this different from other speed dating events?

The brainchild of matchmaker, Danita Walton, Play Dating is a unique dating concept centered around the premise of spontaneity, fun, and connection.

Should you meet your Mr. or Mrs. right we want you to be able to tell the story as if we were never there. So forget about meeting someone and just come out and have some fun!

results.description:
There has been a lot of talk lately of contested conventions and brokered conventions, but what exactly do those terms mean?  And just who ARE these delegates who will be going to Cleveland to represent Pennsylvanians at the Republican National Convention, and how will they be voting?  Are they required to vote a certain way or can they choose their candidate to support?

These prospective delegates will be on the ballot this April, and you should know who they are and who they support before you vote so you can make sure THEIR candidate is also YOUR candidate.  It makes a difference, but how do you know for sure?

Well, Bob Howard has sent a survey to the prospective delegates in the three congressional districts in our area to try to learn more about them.  Bob will be filling us in on his survey results as well as explaining the whole convention and delegate process.  It's a little confusing, but Bob will be there to answer all of our questions; and believe me, the VPU planning committee learned a lot from Bob in our planning meeting and you will too.  Hey, the candidate is still up in the air and Pennsylvania's primary might actually COUNT this year!

After our federal, state, and local updates, we'll also be learning how to connect and how to reach out and share articles and information on Facebook.  Whether you're a beginner or a Facebook regular (like myself), there's always something new to learn.  So come on out and get educated on the delegate process and become active on social media.  It's a great way to reach the masses.

I'll see you then!

Diane
results.name: VPU's Monthly Meeting - Delegates and Conventions!

results.description:
Spring Coed Indoor Soccer League at Monroeville Sports Center - Special Rate of $59 


Sign up as an individual - great way to meet new friends! - with a group of friends or as a full team. 


Choose From:

-Monday Night Coed Recreational (starts 3/28)


-Wednesday Night Coed Recreational (starts 3/30)

What's included in the price?


• 6 weeks of regular season plus up to two weeks of playoffs
• 2 friendly and certified referees per game
• 5v5 (2 women on field minimum)
• Two 25-minute halves
• Championship t-shirts/trophies
• Food/Drink specials at sponsor bar
• We will not place more than 12 players on a roster. Most individual team rosters have 8-10 players.

Format
5v5 (Coed: 3 Males:2 Females--you may have more than 2 females on the field at once, but this is the minimum requirement), includes goalie

When are we playing?
This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from 7:00 PM through 11:00 PM. A full season schedule and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2.


Playing surface and what to wear:
We play on a rubberized field. Shin Guards are mandatory in all league games.


Level of competition:
- Recreational level is ideal for teams just forming, teams with a mix of experienced and novice players and maybe teams that have lost a step or two over the years and are looking for a more relaxed environment.

These leagues are happening!
Don't see a bunch of people registered here? Don't worry! Many people and teams register directly on our sportsmonster.net website instead. So go ahead and sign up to play!


Full Team Registration
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 10. And yes, you can pay for all 10 here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP.


When will I find out which team I'm on?
Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season.

Don't have PayPal? You may register through sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site.

If you have any questions please don't hesitate to ask.
Call:[masked]
E-mail: [masked]


All registrations made through this Meetup event agree to the terms and conditions found on sportsmonster.net.

results.description:
Let's get together for a knit night at Duke's!

NOTE - We thought it would be fun (if you're interested, don't feel like you have to participate) to do a spring/summer beer craft beer exchange. Everyone brings a case (24 beers) of craft beer (note: craft beer is usually thought of as "small batch" beer produced by "independent" brewers - not your Sam Adams of the world). If you are unsure of what you're looking for, go into a beer distributor and ask about "summer craft beers" they should be able to point you in the right direction. We can trade beers at Duke's! Please be sure to post a comment with what beer you're bringing so we don't have any duplicates!

Duke's features a full menu, plenty of draft beers and usually some seasonal cocktail specials! Whether you knit, crochet, do needlepoint, cross stitch - it doesn't matter - all crafters are welcome regardless of skill level! Pack up your project and come out for a fun night of conversation, food and crafting! Hope to see you there!

Note - This Duke's location is on Cochran Road in the plaza with the Max and Erma's and Amerifit - we'll be upstairs to the right of the door.
results.name: Knit night AND CRAFT BEER EXCHANGE at Duke's

results.description:
Leader:  Jack Craig with a little help from Jack Momberger....

An opportunity to really "JAM" with ukulele friends.  Songs are relatively easy to play, and all are upbeat.  We'll play as an extended song, and include opportunities for instrumental breaks and improv bridges.  

Feel free to bring other instruments and other musical "toys": percussion, kazoos, washboard, harmonica, bongos, tambourine, wood blocks, maracas, and shakers.

I've limited the number of tunes so that we can spend more time on each one. We will make up arrangements as we play.


This Meetup is designed for all levels of play - from novice to advanced. This session could be the beginning of something new - or perhaps preparation for a flashmob.


As usual, come early to tune up and get situated. Bring printed music, music stand, tuner, yellow book (just in case).  If you want to try a song not on the list, please bring 15 copies.  We will take a mid-session social break - please feel free to bring finger foods and drinks to share.

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 8:00 at the tennis court of Cranberry Community park and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Wednesday night tennis for all levels - Cranberry

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
